transcription: Persian, which is also called Farsi, is one of the Western Iranian languages that belongs to the Indo-Iranian branch of the Indo-European language family. It is mainly spoken in Iran, Afghanistan, where it's officially known as Dari since 1958, and Tajikistan, where it's referred to as Tajiki since the time of the Soviet Union, along with some other areas that were historically Persianate societies and are considered part of Greater Iran. The language is written in the Persian script, which is a modified version of the Arabic script and this script itself has its roots in the Aramaic alphabet. Do Iran and Afghanistan speak the same language?

Good Samaritan laws provide legal protection to individuals who offer reasonable help to anyone they think is injured, unwell, in danger or otherwise unable to help themselves. The aim of these laws is to encourage bystanders to step in and assist without worrying about being sued or facing legal action for any accidental harm or wrongful death. For instance, in Common Law Regions of Canada, the Good Samaritan doctrine is a legal principle that shields a rescuer who voluntarily aids someone in distress from being successfully sued for any wrongdoing. The idea is to ensure that people don't hesitate to help a stranger in need out of fear of facing legal consequences if they make a mistake while providing assistance. On the other hand, a duty to rescue law mandates that individuals must offer help and holds those who don't accountable. Do Good Samaritan laws protect those who help in an accident?

Windows Movie Maker, which used to be called Windows Live Movie Maker in Windows 7, is a video editing software from Microsoft that is no longer in use. It is included in the Windows Essentials software suite and allows you to create and edit videos, as well as share them on platforms like OneDrive, Facebook, Vimeo, YouTube, and Flickr. Is Windows Movie Maker a part of Windows Essentials?

Powdered sugar, which is also known as confectioner's sugar icing sugar or icing sugar for cakes, is basically granulated sugar that has been ground down to a fine powder. It usually has a bit of anti-caking agent mixed in to stop it from clumping and to help it flow better. While it's mostly made in factories, you can also make powdered sugar at home by grinding regular granulated sugar in a coffee grinder or by crushing it manually using a mortar and pestle. Is confectioner's sugar the same as powdered sugar?

Like the other games in the Elder Scrolls series, this game is set in the continent of Tamriel. The events take place a thousand years before the Elder Scrolls V, Skyrim and about 800 years before the Elder Scrolls III, Morrowind and the Elder Scrolls IV, Oblivion. It has a similar structure to Skyrim, featuring two separate conflicts happening simultaneously. One that determines the fate of the world and another where the goal is to gain supreme power over Tamriel. In the Elder Scrolls Online, the first conflict is against the Daedric Prince Molag Bal, who is trying to merge the plane of Mundus with his realm of Coldharbour. The second conflict involves capturing the vacant Imperial throne, which is being fought over by three alliances of the mortal races. The player character has been sacrificed to Molag Bal, who has taken their soul and recovering it is the main objective of the game. Is Elder Scrolls Online the same as Skyrim?

Epsom Railway Station caters to the town of Epsom in Surrey. It's situated just off Waterloo Road and is hardly a 2-minute walk from the High Street. Unlike Epsom Downs or Tatternham Corner stations, it's not within the London Oyster Card Zone. The station building was revamped in 2012-2013 and now there's a new structure with apartments on top of the station. Do check the end of the article for more details. Can you use an Oyster Card at Epsom Station?

The series started airing in the US on Starz on 12th of April 2013 and the second season came out on 22nd March 2014. They renewed it for a third season which premiered on 24th October 2015. But on 23rd July 2015, Starz announced that the third season would be the final one. However, Goyer has hinted that there might be a chance for a miniseries comeback. Will there be a season 4 of Da Vinci's Demons?

The federal courts are made up of three levels of courts. The Supreme Court of the United States is the highest court, where you go when all other options are exhausted. It mainly functions as an appellate court, which means it has the discretion to decide which cases it wants to hear by granting writs of category. So there isn't really a guaranteed right to appeal that automatically goes all the way to the Supreme Court. In certain situations, like cases between state governments or some matters involving the federal government and a state, it acts as a court of original jurisdiction. Is the federal court same as the Supreme Court?

In the 1998 war film, Saving Private Ryan, General George Marshall, played by Harv Presnell, reads out the Bixby letter to his officers before he gives the order to find and send back Private James Francis Ryan, after Ryan's three brothers were killed in battle. Did Abraham Lincoln write the letter in Saving Private Ryan?

After the success of Batman Forever at the box office in June 1995, Warner Brothers quickly decided to make a sequel. They brought back director Joel Schumacher and writer Akiva Goldsman in August of the same year, and they thought it would be best to speed up the production for a release in June 1997, which is quite different from the usual three-year gap between films. Schumacher wanted to pay tribute to both the fun, campy style of the 1960s television series and the artwork of Dick Sprang. The story for Batman and Robin was developed by Schumacher and Goldsman while they were working on A Time to Kill. Some parts of Mr. Freeze's backstory were inspired by the Batman, the animated series episode Heart of Ice, which was written by Paul Dini. Is Batman and Robin a sequel to Batman Forever?

Badgers are short-legged omnivores that belong to the Mustelidae family, which also includes otters, polecats, weasels, and wolverines. They are part of the caniform suborder of carnivorous mammals. There are 11 species of badgers, which are divided into three subfamilies. Melinae, Eurasian badgers, Melivarinae, the honey badger or ratel, and Taxidenae, the American badger. The Asiatic stink badgers from the genus Midas were previously classified under Melinae and thus Mustelidae, but recent genetic studies have shown that they actually belong to the skunk family, which places them in the taxonomic family Mephitidae. Is a wolverine the same as a badger?

Green Lantern released on June 17, 2011, and it got mostly negative reviews. Many people criticized the film for its screenplay, inconsistent tone, the choice and portrayal of villains, and the use of CGI, though some did appreciate Reynolds' acting. Later on, Reynolds himself expressed his disappointment with the film. It didn't do well at the box office, earning $219 million against a production budget of $200 million. Because of the negative feedback and the poor box office performance, Warner Bros. decided to cancel any plans for a sequel. Instead, they chose to reboot the character in the DC Extended Universe with a film called Green Lantern Co., which is set to release in 2020. Will there be a Green Lantern 2 movie?

Keeping these concerns in mind, I will not and I do not suggest that my successor submit the treaty to the Senate for their advice and consent until our core concerns are addressed. Does the IGEC have jurisdiction in the United States?

Calcium carbide is a chemical compound with the formula CaC2. Its primary industrial use is for making acetylene and calcium cyanamide. Calcium carbide CaC2 is the raw material for the production of acetylene.

Now You See Me is a series of heist thriller films written by Ed Solomon, Boaz Yakin and Edward Ricoeur. The story revolves around a group of illusionists called the Four Horsemen who manage to pull off seemingly impossible heists. The series boasts a talented ensemble cast including Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Woody Harrelson, Isla Fisher, Dave Franco, Michael Caine, Lizzie Kaplan and Morgan Freeman. The first film came out in 2013, followed by the second one in 2016 and a third film is currently in the works, expected to release in 2019. The series has received a mix of reviews from critics and audiences alike and has earned nearly $700 million globally. Is there a Now You See Me 3 coming out?

A shootout is generally seen as something separate from the match which preceded it, especially for statistical reasons. In a two-legged tie, the two matches are treated either as two draws or as one win and one loss. For a single match, it's still counted as a draw. This is different from a match that is won in extra time, where the score at the end of regular time doesn't matter anymore. Penalties scored during a shootout are not counted as goals for a player's individual records or for the Golden Boot Awards. Does a penalty shootout goal count towards the Golden Boot?

Cutthroat Kitchen is a cooking show hosted by Alton Brown that was aired on the Food Network from August 11, 2013 to July 19, 2017. It features four chefs competing in a three-round elimination cooking competition. The contestants have to face auctions where they can buy chances to sabotage each other. Each chef starts with $25,000. The one who remains at the end keeps whatever money they haven't spent in the auctions. The show concluded with its 15th season in July 2017. This series shares some basic elements with other four-chef, three-round elimination-style competitions on the Food Network, like Chopped N' Guys grocery games. Many contestants from Cutthroat Kitchen have also participated in these shows. Will there be a new season of Cutthroat Kitchen?

In 2006, Sigma was voted as one of the 100 legends of the IHSR Boys Basketball Tournament, which is a group of former players and coaches recognized for the 100th anniversary of the IHSR Boys Basketball Tournament. On June 27, 2017, Sigma was inducted into the Small College Basketball Hall of Fame as part of their second class. Along with Sigma, others who were inducted include Zelmo Beatty, Walt Fraser, Bob Love, Elmore Smith, Jim Spivey, Rico Swanson, George Tinsley, and Al Tucker. Is Jack Sigma in the Hall of Fame?

In J.R.R. Tolkien's imaginary world of Middle-earth, the half-elven, in Sindarin, it's peredil for singular and peredil for plural, while in Quenya, it's perelda for singular, are the children of the union between elves and men. Among these, the most notable were the result of relationships between the Eldar, the elves who answered the call to Valinor, and the Aedain, the men from the three houses of early humans who joined forces with the Eldar in their battle against Moggoth. Can elves and humans have children in Lord of the Rings?

The Boy in the Plastic Bubble is a 1976 American television drama film inspired by the true stories of David Vetter and Ted DeVita, who had weak immune systems. It features John Travolta, Glynis O'Connor, Dinah Hyland, Robert Reed, Ralph Bellamy, and P.J. Soules. The screenplay was penned by Douglas Day Stewart, with Aaron Spelling and Leonard Goldberg serving as executive producers. They were also behind shows like Starsky and Hutch and Charlie's Angels at that time. And it was directed by Randall Kleiser, who later collaborated with Travolta again in Greece. The original music score was created by Mark Snow and the theme song, What Would They Say, was written and performed by Paul Williams. The filming took place at William Howard Taft High School in Woodland Hills. The Boy in the Plastic Bubble, based on a true story,

These terms are used in relation to reasoning epistemology to differentiate between necessary conclusions from first premises, that is, what needs to come before sensory observation and conclusions based on sensory observation, which should follow it. So the two types of knowledge, justification or argument can be explained as follows. It starts with the idea that we should first gain knowledge through observation.

Timothy Donnell Brown, who was born on July 22, 1966, is a former American football wide receiver. He played professionally in the National Football League, NFL. During his college days, he played for Notre Dame, where he won the Heisman Trophy, making him the first wide receiver to achieve that honor. He spent a remarkable 16 years with the Los Angeles Tides Oakland Raiders, where he made a name for himself as one of the most prolific wide receivers in the NFL. Brown has also had a stint with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. In 2015, he was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame. Is Tim Brown in the Hall of Fame?

In Denmark, drinking in public is generally allowed. The law only prohibits disturbing public peace and order. So casual drinking is quite acceptable. Many cafes even have outdoor seating in those areas. Can you drink alcohol in public in Denmark?

Both Jersey notes and Bank of England notes are considered legal tender in Jersey and they circulate together, along with the Guernsey Pound and Scottish Bank notes. However, the Jersey notes are not legal tender in the United Kingdom, but they are recognized as legal currency. So creditors and traders can accept them if they want to. Is the Jersey currency legal tender in the UK?

The Bucks have won one league title in 1971, two conference titles in 1971 and 1974, and 13 division titles from 1971 to 1984, 1986, 1980 to 1986, and in 2001. They have had some really famous players like Karim Abdul-Jabbar, Sidney Moncrieff, Oscar Robertson, Bob Dandridge, Bob Lanier, Glenn Robinson, Ray Allen, Sam Cassell, Junior Bridgman, Michael Redd, Terry Cummings, Winn Baker, John McLaughlin, Marcus Johnson, and Brian Winters. Have the Milwaukee Bucks ever won a championship?

This is a list of all the penalty shootouts that have happened in the finals tournament of the FIFA World Cup. Penalty shootouts were introduced as tiebreakers in the 1978 World Cup, but they didn't happen before 1982. The first time a World Cup title was decided by a penalty shootout was in 1994. The only other time it happened was in 2006. By the end of the 2018 edition, there have been 30 shootouts in the World Cup. Out of these, only two went to the sudden death stage after being tied even after the best of five kicks. Does the World Cup final go to penalties?

Kingdom Kingudamu Kingudamu is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Yasuhisa Hara, Yuan Taiju, Hara Yasuhisa. The manga tells a fictionalized story set during the warring states period, mainly following the journey of a war orphan named Sin and his friends, as he strives to become the greatest general under the heavens, and in the process unifies China for the first time in history. The series was adapted into a 38-episode anime by Studio Pierrot, which aired from June 4, 2012 to February 25, 2013. A second season was announced and aired from June 8, 2013 to March 4, 2014. Funimation has licensed the English-language release of the anime. Is Kingdom manga based on a true story?

As of 2014, the contracting parties to the EEA include 3 out of the 4 EFTA member states and 27 of the 28 EU member states. The 28th and latest EU member, Croatia, completed its negotiations for joining the EEA in November 2013 and from 12 April 2014, it has been provisionally applying the agreement while waiting for all EEA member states to ratify it. Is Croatia part of the European Economic Area?

Posthumous marriage, or necrogyny as it's called, is when one of the people getting married is no longer alive. This is actually legal in France and similar practices can be seen in places like Sudan and China. Since World War I, France has received hundreds of such requests every year and many of them have been approved. Can you marry a dead person in France?
